website_summaries.verdict: Cable service subscribers looking for a device that's both a modem and wireless router with less than high-demand throughput needs will find the Surfboard worth a look. A bonus is its support for MoCA devices.
pros: 802.11ac wireless router and cable modem in one
Perked up upload speed and download speed a bit
cons: Lack of help and user manual

customer_reviews.title: Outdated
customer_reviews.text: I feel this is now outdated. It is a misnomer to say it is "dual band". It is not "simultaneous" dual band as it can only be set to one or the other (2.4 vs 5) at the same time. I need both and the signal kept going in and out even standing beside it. I'm somewhat tech savvy and tried playing with the settings but never got it to work with a stable signal so I bought a motorola instead that has simultaneous dual band. Sorry but not cool guys - where's the transparency!?
customer_reviews.author: Lora L. Hish

customer_reviews.title: Keep them separated
customer_reviews.text: The cable modem is great and my hardwired devices run smooth at blazing speeds. However, the wifi is very unstable and I have to reset it several times a week over the past year and a half. I bought a db reducer to get the signal strength into the recommended range of +-6db and still had the same problems. My final solution was to get a separate wireless router which has been amazing. The speed is faster and the range is stronger. My recommendation is to get a separate router and modem that way as technology changes then it will be easier to keep up with it and replace.
customer_reviews.author: dangerboy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This things was no fuss to set up, comes with parental controls (you can completely shut down the internet during certain times of day through the router's IP, if desired, for all computers and other devices on your network), and has worked consistently without any problems for over 6 months now. I use it for my mobile phone, a Kindle Fire, and two laptops, and never have a problem with lagging. The range is far enough to cover our home entirely (a single-story, three bedroom house) and our backyard (which is not small). Very happy with this purchase, and very happy to not be paying the cable company for their "rental" anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Stuffy

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: I dont understand the comments on this, I installed July 2016 with Comcast and has worked flawlessly. I use for internet, watch Amazon on my TV, listen to Pandora with this on TV and stream Comcast movies on my iPad in the bedroom using this. Easy to setup and have not experienced any issues in nearly two years.
customer_reviews.author: MSKE

customer_reviews.title: Old but never used...no warranty
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Purchased “new” product from my ISP commzoom approved list, only to learn they will not help me set up. Called Arris tech support since my amazon product is “new” only to learn they also won’t help me set up since it past warranty. Seems my “new” product sold by third Amazon company is actually old but never “used” so no warranty. I’m in a loophole. Need to work from home during this pandemic but can’t due to internet/product issues.
customer_reviews.author: MC17

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Originally had it's little brother. Still do. This fixed all my streaming issues with Vudu, Hulu, and Netflix. Before I got his, in the middle of a movie, it would stop and buffer. No way to enjoy a movie. No I can have multiple media streaming device running at the same time and 0 issues.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Very nice piece of hardware
customer_reviews.text: Very nice piece of hardware. Device is great because its a cable modem and router all in one unit. Helps reduce clutter and extra wires running two separate devices. The performance with DOCSIS is phenomenal with great speeds. The interface is easy to use. Programming passwords and other settings are easy to use and the terminology is easy to understand even for the most novice users. Also the device looks nice My modem is my living room in plain view and the glossy black looks matches many other common electronics in todays market.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lo

customer_reviews.title: Run away, don't walk...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in late July to enable me to telework from home once a week. It never worked properly and my IT department requested that I plug in with a wire since they couldn't identify the problem. By the time my cable provider got out to my house last week (October 24) they said the unit was bad, and now I have to rent one from them. I don't know if this device came to me bad, or went bad, but I never had acceptable service through it. Of course, I can't return it now because it's been more than 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Charity Keen

customer_reviews.title: Motorola knows that this modem router is complete garbage. Not only will you get intermittent connection problems ...
customer_reviews.text: I will keep it short and simple. Motorola knows that this modem router is complete garbage. Not only will you get intermittent connection problems (disconnection from wifi every damn second). IF you are a GAMER or BUSINESS person save yourself the trouble either buy a Netgear AC1900 or a Zoom 5341J and a separate router.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: drops wireless signal far too often
customer_reviews.text: drops wireless constantly. Have to unplug, wait, and plug back in. This is 2016, not 1986. I'm not accustomed to having to unplug my modem and replug it for several decades now. I wanted to save money by not paying $10-12 month to cable company for their modem, but somewhat regretting the decision now. It is not a problem with the cable - never a problem if plugged in with cable to computer. But that doesn't help with my phone, ipad, or laptop. Plus, I'm not used to having a cable in my computer anymore - it's worked for years off wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Works really good.
customer_reviews.text: We have had this product for three years now. It works really well we have a two-story house. Internet gets into all the rooms about 1400 ft.2 . It does need to be reset occasionally. But I feel like that everybody has the same problem. Or it's our Internet provider. But for the most part we are very happy with this product and I would buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Helpyou

customer_reviews.title: Worked great after my internet provider got it set up.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with it now that my service provider got it set up. It took them over an hour over the phone to get it going and it was one of their recommended modems. Now that it works, I've only had a dropped connection once in two weeks and my stuff is at the opposite end of the house from the modem. I have my laptop, I-Phone, printer, and Blu-Ray player, all working happily together. It was very easy to get everything connected, only having to use the pairing button once for the dvd player. It seems to be entirely plug and play, I needed no software to get it going.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: I installed this modem without incident. It works perfectly ...
customer_reviews.text: I installed this modem without incident. It works perfectly. I have had other modems, and have had problems with them being knocked off line. This one has been in for many days now and I have not had one problem. At first the seller thought the modem might not work with my ISP and contacted me to warn me of this before they shipped it. I called Time Warner and verified that it would indeed work. This is an honest company who had integrity. I would gladly do business with them again!
customer_reviews.author: Daziegrl411

customer_reviews.title: Very good cable all in one
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this years ago and it served us well and would still most people well even today. Even being 6 year old model it is still plenty fast for streaming and whatever. We recently replaced it with a top of the line separate modem and WiFi router. We have sometimes 4 TVs streaming , 2 iphones, a laptop and a tablet and other things in the background online at once for us we needed a performance jump, but for most everyone else this is a good buy
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeyefanjustin

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity issues
customer_reviews.text: Although this is the same model that I had been leading through my internet provider, this modem has been a pain to work with. Here's a list why: -setup instructions very vague. - modem was not factory reset - had to do that myself in order to enable wifi setup. - something wrong with either the plug or power jack in that it doesn't stay fully plugged in making shutoffs very likely and easy. I've had to jump through a lot of hoops to get this working but I'm tired of the random outages due to faulty equipment. If I can't find a permanent solution I will be returning this product...
customer_reviews.author: Chris Casey

customer_reviews.title: Wifi doesn't work well.
customer_reviews.text: It's works OK as a cable modem. However, as a wireless router, it sucks! I did the speed comparison between cable and wifi, below is the result for your reference: - Average internet speed when using cable: Up ~5.8Mbps | Down ~82.7Mbps - Average internet speed when using wifi: Up: ~4Mbps | Down ~2.2Mbps I googled around to find some solution to speed up my wifi speed, but no matter what I try, the wifi speed still sucks. Below are several things I tried: - Nightly restart the modem - Set Wifi mode to "n only" instead of "b/g/n" - Switch frequency back and forth between 2.4GHz & 5GHz - Put the modem next to my desk - ...
customer_reviews.author: Ngoc Vo

customer_reviews.title: looks cool, doesn't work worth a crap
customer_reviews.text: Flaming pile of junk. I can't think of this getting any worse. The wireless is so flakey it's actually not worth using. It connects and I get 20Mbps but within 2 minutes is disconnects. When it reconnects 10 minutes later it maxes out at 2Mbps for 15 minutes. Repeat incessantly. If I could give this 0 stars I would. I've found that disconnecting it from the internet and using it as a coaster has proved significantly more valuable of a tool. Motorola should be ashamed for not putting out a recall and an apology to anyone who bought them, then flying us all outto headquarters to give them a swift kick in the arse. Shame on you!
customer_reviews.author: Slomo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Deal!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this $120 modem for only $19 on Amazon Warehouse Deals! It's a great modem and we have had no issues with it. We replaced the modem from our provider which we rented for $10.50 a month, so it's easy to do they math. If you patiently look you can find amazing deals at Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Works outstanding with Wow cable
customer_reviews.text: I just change my cable company to Wow and decided to get my own modem instead if renting one. Found this and not only works great but also replace my wifi extender. I have a 4 bedroom house and fills the hole hose with the same speed and signal. The photo was the result of 3 test I made. Next to the modem in the master bedroom, in tha farest bedroom (the office) and downstairs in the other corner of the house and as you can see the signal is pretty much the same, the only difference was the ping Overall: recommend this product hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Gomez

customer_reviews.title: For very small condos with 1 or fewer users
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a piece of junk. I'd rather use Comcast's rental modem than keep using it. Despite googling and spending hours tinkering with the settings I've never been able to get it to support more than 2 users at a time. If 3 people try to do anything everyone starts getting time outs. Also the range is terrible, a computer with a PCIe wireless card barely gets a signal at 45 feet. This is the worst modem I've used in the last 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: R. Withey

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed! Even called Amazon customer service because there was no manual or quick start guide. Promised a follow up... Didn't happen!! It doesn't stay connected, have to reset the box at least once a week and doesn't get any better speed than the cheap one I rented from the cable company that didn't have the capacity to give me all the speed I was paying for. Poor purchase choice. Wouldnt recommend to anyone! UPDATE 2/19/16..... finally had cable company come out because our service stopped working, as suspected, this modem was the cause! Hadn't worked properly since the day I got it! I called Amazon for their help, got a promised call back..... NOTHING! What a waste of money!!
customer_reviews.author: Momof5

customer_reviews.title: A little unhappy with the hassle but real happy that I don't have to pay for the rental ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cable modem to replace the one I was renting from your internet service provider. Seem to work real well at first but then started to periodically lock up and had to be powered off and back on to get back onto the internet. I have had some other people complain about the same issues with this model. Supposedly a firmware update will fix the problem but my internet service provider will need to implement the update since they have configured it to work with their systems. A little unhappy with the hassle but real happy that I don't have to pay for the rental anymore.
customer_reviews.author: TinyT

customer_reviews.title: It is a good product, I wanted to use for some time ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product, I wanted to use for some time before reviewing it. After using it for 2 months and for a used product I think it is ok. It is not perfect, not the same performance of brand new but I can live with it. internet connection gets interrupted sometimes but not frequently in a very annoying way. Seller was honest and I accepted that. I am giving 3 stars just to tell that a used product will never be the same performance of brand new, other than that I got my product on time and as described.
customer_reviews.author: Anas

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little more and get the 6700-AC modem. 2.4/5.0 dual concurrent modem is much better for many different types of devices.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and configure however the wifi even though connected and the signal strength was excellent the internet would never continously work unless i would turn wifi off and then on. Also if you live in apt building or high traffic area use 5.0 ghz otherwise 2.4 ghz you would get very very slow speed no matter if you turn off the WMM feature and configure it up, down, side to side. The 5.0 ghz is excellent for congested area however a lot of devices dont yet work for it especially android phones. Get the dual concurrent 2.4/5.0 ghz router you will NOT REGRET it. I bought the 6700 arris router and no problems yet.
customer_reviews.author: nisx

customer_reviews.title: Have to reset the router at least twice a week
customer_reviews.text: This router was cheaply priced, and now I know why. I have to reset my network all the time, as it gets incredibly slow, or loses signal altogether. I only ever have a max of 3 devices connected, and usually its only 1 or 2 (laptop or phone). Just disappointed with this router, and clearly is the tech of yesteryear. Save your money and get a newer router
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: They don't make them like they used to
customer_reviews.text: I recently called Comcast to set up service at my new place, and the technician on the other end couldn't believe I still have this modem. Literally, he didn't believe me. I've had this thing since... I can't even remember... 2009? 2010? And I rarely have issues. Granted, there was a time a few years go when Comcast pushed through a firmware upgrade the broke my internet, but a hard reset fixed that and I haven't had the issue again. With Comcast's technician claiming that most modems last 1-2 years, I dread the day that I have the replace this workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T.

customer_reviews.title: I had difficulty activating the SBG6580. Cox Cable (Internet ...
customer_reviews.text: I had difficulty activating the SBG6580. Cox Cable (Internet provider) was unable to assist. I called Arris Motorola Tech Support for assistance. Based on the Model/SN I provided; I was told that my supposedly new product is "Out of the 2-yr Warranty period). If I wanted tech assistance from them; I would have to pay $32. This is strange; because I just received this product (from Amazon) 1-day prior. I declined & paid $25. for a Cox Cable Sub Contractor to visit my home. The situation was corrected; the product/modem was NOT the problem. However -the issue is still .... not getting any help from Arris Motorola because the product/SBG6580 modem I received was >2-yrs old (past warranty). Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Waipahu

customer_reviews.title: Not so “GREAT” Modem.
customer_reviews.text: Update: Modem worked ok for about 3 months and the speed slowed drastically. Also had connectivity issues. It took me a minute to update but I would not recommend this modem. I had to reduce the rating to two stars. ******************************************************* Great product. I purchased a refurbished model for half the price and it works very well. I am more than happy with this modem. It works better than the Comcast modem I replaced. I no longer have to pay Comcast rental fees for a modem and this one gives a more powerful signal. I've had this refurbished modem for almost a year now, no problems no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Adequate in both range and preformance
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars although its not the ultimate model. But for the price it preforms well in both reception area and performance.The interface while being straight forward but missing highly techie adjustment options. Motorola is used my most internet companies and has good dependability on most models. I prefer to have my router and wireless in one unit because its cheaper and saves on congestion. I place the unit 50+ feet from my workstation because other computers in different rooms and receive no loss in the mbps or drops as I did with my previous failed model from another manufacturer when the wife used the microwave.
customer_reviews.author: gmano050

customer_reviews.title: A little mixed. Bought to replace Time Warner rental ...
customer_reviews.text: A little mixed. Bought to replace Time Warner rental. Has been fairly consistent in performance but I have had to add a TP Link repeater to carry the signal to my p.c. on second floor. Also, speedtest.net throughput numbers vary greatly althought this could be due to many factors. Probably would try another brand for next router.
customer_reviews.author: marcoyaz

customer_reviews.title: it would not work properly so I got ahold of ...
customer_reviews.text: it would not work properly so I got ahold of arris and all they would do is blame my cable co.the cable company ran a qualitty test and the cable co said it was with in limits. Got with arris and they where still blaming my cable co.and no one cood to work correctly so the left me no chose but to send it back witch is what I did it was mailed back to Ocean Reef the only thing the cable co. found the soft ware was out dated by about 4 years
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Varian

customer_reviews.title: Very bad range in 5 GHz connection
customer_reviews.text: I tried this modem for couple of days and found that this particular modem has a pathetic connectivity range. I live in a one bedroom apartment and I've the modem in the living room. Only if the modem is in 2.4 GHz I can connect from my bedroom. But 2.4 GHz has greater interference and hence the speed is low. Once I switched to 5 GHz the connection completely dropped almost to none in my bedroom. I contacted their customer care with no luck and sadly had to return this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Raghav

customer_reviews.title: Not for advanced users or those looking for customization
customer_reviews.text: One thing I discovered is that it doesn't allow for customization of DNS servers, it's hard-wired somewhere into the firmware of the device. This is a pretty basic thing to customize, so for those looking for particular capabilities that you would have in a standalone wireless router, please double check that this can support the functions you need. Had I known about the limited customization capabilities of this device I would have probably purchased something else. Otherwise the modem works fine with Charter cable service. The wifi also seems to work, although I haven't put it through its paces.
customer_reviews.author: queenbee

customer_reviews.title: This is a great replacement modem and router (gateway) for Time Warner and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great replacement modem and router (gateway) for Time Warner and Cox internet services. Highly recommended, easy to setup, and long lasting. Check Amazon Warehouse deals for used/refurbished units that are much cheaper and yet still look and function like they are brand new. Once you receive it, make sure to call your cable company and provide them with your serial number and MAC address to they can unblock it and allow you to access your service.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Stay away...frequent connection drops
customer_reviews.text: Update: Connection dropouts are occurring number of times in a day and is getting very frustrating. Extremely disappointed with the long term performance of this router. I think I should have stuck with a separate modem and router. Have started looking at some other options which will offer stability. Positives: 1. Good modern look and does not take up too much space. 2. Signal strength is good throughout the house. 3. Easy to setup Negatives: 1. Slows down after a few days. I end up power cycling the unit and that has seemed to help. (need to check if this is a known issue with some way to resolve it)
customer_reviews.author: Kiran Ambre

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the rented modem I'm trying to replace
customer_reviews.text: I'm among the many people who can't seem to connect wirelessly to this device with any reliability. My phone connects ok, but on my desktop computer I get endless DNS and ERR connection messages and I literally can't maintain a connection long enough to, say, pay a bill. I've tried every computer fix the internet message boards can offer and customer support has no better suggestion than "keep changing the channel, there must be a lot of interference." Trying to decide whether to return and try again w something else or just get a really long ethernet cable.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J. Bamonte Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Have had this since 2015, now its 2019 works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this from Amazon and have been using since 2015 and now its 2019 and it reaches down to the basemen from the 2nd floor, out in the patio, and at least 30 ft out to the garage and when i'm parked in front of the house. I saw some bad ratings that were given and thought that was unfair.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Slow connections.
customer_reviews.text: Update again. Sorry it took a while. After getting help. Item works great. Sometimes it loses connection but nothing a soft reboot doesn’t solve. It’s been 3 years so far. Update on review, after not getting much help from Motorola, I called Time Warner and they had me change some coding on the Motorola web page and item works fine. Terrible item. Never had any issues with intermittent or buffering while streaming until the day I disconnect my old wireless modem and connected this item. I'm trying to see if there's anything Motorola can do, otherwise I will have to return and purchase a different item.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem
customer_reviews.text: I was a little leery of buying a modem but I didn't want to keep giving $12 monthly to Comcast for theirs. So after doing some research on various modems (price vs. features) this was my choice soI took the plunge and am very glad I did. This modem works exactly as my old Comcast modem. It was easy to set up (even without manual or software) and I was on the internet right away. I did have a little trouble setting up the wireless part but finally worked it out. Bought mine used for $79 only came with unit and AC cable but no problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: MACK D.

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The one I received only had the router, Ethernet cable, and the wall charger but zero instructions as to how to properly connect it to my xfinity box. I called xfinity to see if it was their equipment that was faulty but it turned out to be the router I got off of here. Now I have to get another router because I'm a full time college student who needs home wifi. Very disappointed with what I was sent. Looked more like an eBay product than an Amazon product
customer_reviews.author: SeahawkPride13

customer_reviews.title: and worked just fine. i am getting 123 Mbps down and 24 ...
customer_reviews.text: I picked up a certified sbg6580 for $57 through the vendor Lyon's electronics on amazon. The modem arrived quickly, and worked just fine. i am getting 123 Mbps down and 24 Mbps up. Although this item is a dual band, I didn't see how to enable both of the frequencies. This didn't matter for my as i only wanted a docsis 3 modem, and a gigabit router. I have another wireless router that I use, so the sbg6580 has the wireless off. Compared to the brand new docsis3 modems, this one is a good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Fine for a few months then nothing but trouble
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a few months, then started having problems. Intermittent access, or slow... constantly resetting the modem. Then last week, was troubleshooting with Comcast. After "hard resetting" the modem, everything died. No signal at all. Once it was fixed, happened again days later... random slow down. Finally got tired of it and reconnected my old Motorola modem with a separate router... it worked fine and has been lightning fast. I bought this unit based on the reviews I read. Thought it would have been nice to have an integrated modem/router. Better off to have a good modem and a good router. I do NOT recommend SBG6580.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Router has an admin account and backdoor root account, password is motorola, change both!!
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars because the default password in the manual is wrong. It's "motorola" not "password." Also, not only does this have an admin account but it also has a "root" backdoor account which is insanely stupid because the default password for this account is also "password" and gives that user full access to the router EVEN IF you've changed the admin account name and password. So dumb. Be sure to change the passwords on both accounts. Who knows if there are any other default backdoor accounts.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K

customer_reviews.title: 2.4 or 5.0 not both
customer_reviews.text: I can't get this router to broadcast in 2.4 and 5.0 at the same time. I can switch between the two. I want the router in 5.0 mode because so many routers in our apartment are set to 2.4. The downfall is some of our equipment (printer, sound bar, old laptop) does not pick up the 5.0 network. If I could go back and buy it again I would choose a model that broadcasts 2.4 and 5.0 at the same time. I should probably learn to read a product description better but it didn't cross my mind. Now I know.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Mcgovern

customer_reviews.title: 3in1 Solution to Save Monthly Modem Rental
customer_reviews.text: A little large in size compared to the modem supplied by Time Warner. We have 3in1 service so had to keep the old modem for phone and use this for internet and cable all to save the $5.99 monthly modem rental. You still have to call your service provider once you set it up to separate the signals. They will disable the internet and cable from their modem so that it only handles the phone and activate yours on their end with the IP address of the new modem. Works fine and doesn't interfere with your router and wireless connections. Worked seamlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Dennie

customer_reviews.title: 2 and l/2 years and still working great!
customer_reviews.text: purchased this in December of 2015 and here it is May, 2018 and it is still working beautifully...great product.
customer_reviews.author: loni

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT use with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: As far as I can tell, this is an excellent modem/router combo. It supports fast connections and doesn't seem to have any issues, except for one... This is the modem/router the Comcast sales people suggest purchasing, but the Comcast tech support will tell you they do not support this modem/router. Additionally they will not provide firmware upgrades, which will leave you with dropped connections almost daily and will cause many expensive tech visits. As long as you are not in Comcast, this is an excellent piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Joe G.

customer_reviews.title: Works great on Windows; a constant nagging thorn in your side if you use a Mac!
customer_reviews.text: While this modem works perfectly with windows machines and iPhones, it cannot maintain a connection with any Apple MacBooks. Several calls to Apple and online searches show others are having similar problems. If you have a Macbook, stay away from this router and save yourself the headache. Apparently, contacting Motorola won't solve the problem either as they have no idea what the problem is. Ever since we bought this modem, the wifi function works with our Macbook Pro and Macbook Air anywhere from a few seconds to 10 minutes before stopping. The wifi is still connected but there is no internet. The only way to get a connection is to disconnect and reconnect to the wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca T

customer_reviews.title: I didn't have to do anything since the cable guy did it all but he told me this was the best one to get
customer_reviews.text: Bought on Amazon for use with Time Warner Cable. I didn't have to do anything since the cable guy did it all but he told me this was the best one to get. It was then easy to set up our wireless printers after with the WPS button in the front. It was also $50 cheaper than at Walmart. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Glaser

customer_reviews.title: Great Cable Modem/Router.  Good performance and does what I need.
customer_reviews.text: Update 9/16/14. I had my review for the SBG6580 and SB6141 reversed. Sorry for any confusion. Great modem. Blazing fast speeds from Time Warner Cable (100Mbps). And glad to not be paying the monthly fee to Time Warner to rent a cable modem. The Router is decent. Not as easy to configure Port Forwarding and other advanced options as my old router, but still easy enough. One tip: The admin password in the included documentation is WRONG. I had to call tech support for them to tell me the correct default password (it is motorola and not password as stated in the documentation).
customer_reviews.author: MattM

customer_reviews.title: Wireless coverage half of a basic stand alone wireless router.
customer_reviews.text: Was getting 57.00 Mbps download though the direct connection on the modem through TWC. Connect any iPad, laptop or PC via wireless and the best you will get is 7-15 Mbps download speeds. I tried each of the 11 channels it has but nothing really helped. No other wireless routers within miles so there was no interference issues. If I put a wireless device right up against it I could get 25-35 Mbps download speeds. Move away 10 ft and I would get 10-20 Mbps download. Returned the unit back to Amazon. And ordered the sb6141 modem along with a separate Netgear Nighhawk wireless router. Problem solved and now have fast wireless internet.
customer_reviews.author: VIPbeachBum

customer_reviews.title: So far so good (Fingers crossed)
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this set up for about a week and I don't want to get overconfident. But as of today it is working fine. The only thing that threw me about the setup was as soon as the gateway was connected and I powered up my computer, a Comcast window opened in my browser and asked for my Comcast account number. I had to dig out my previous bill to get the number. I used the enclosed DVD to walk me through the set up and it configured and secured a wireless network. The SBG6580 is small which is nice. About 6" tall, 6.5" deep and about 2" across. About the size of the old cable modems.
customer_reviews.author: gwpriester

customer_reviews.title: Compact 2-in-1
customer_reviews.text: I was a little afraid that it wasn't working at first...but after several calls to TWC it finally worked. Surprise, surprise, the problem was on the service providers end not the unit. I like that it is the modem and wireless router in one. It saves visual space (electrical outlets, cords, separate etc.). I also has built in mounting molds so it will be easy to mount to the wall with two screws once I figure out where I really want it to live. I would recommend this to anyone paying for a rental fee each month from their cable company! Only thing I would change is to make it a more neutral color, black just sticks out so much.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle S.

customer_reviews.title: and are so far pretty satisfied with its performance
customer_reviews.text: We bought this so we didn't have to rent from Oceanic Time Warner Cable anymore. We purchased the refurbished one, and are so far pretty satisfied with its performance. While we have to reset the router every so often (not sure if this is because of a factory defect or just a fact of life with routers), it will usually work after the reset. Our walls are made of stone, so we typically have a hard time getting reception in bedrooms. We were hoping this router would have been strong enough, but it wasn't. Speeds are decent. This router works decently, and is good for small apartments.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Q.

customer_reviews.title: Stop paying rental fees!
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaced a flaky Comcast residential gateway (non-Voice) and works great. One caveat: the default administrative username/password was not as written on the documentation. Instead of "admin" for username and password, it was "admin" for username and "motorola" for password. The WiFi range was a concern as the Comcast unit was pretty bad, and I had a fairly large area to cover. Surprisingly, this unit has exceeded my expectations with very solid 2.4GHz range. Based on the various toggles available in the spartan interface, I wasn't entirely sure if enabling 5GHz would disable 2.4, or if it has dual radio support, so I left it off -- I need range over speed.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Yocum

customer_reviews.title: The WiFi is terrible. Sitting 30ft from it in clear line of ...
customer_reviews.text: Set up was simple, plugged it in and it connected to Comcast Xfinity without having to fool around with anything. The WiFi is terrible. Sitting 30ft from it in clear line of sight, I have half-power showing up on any device I try it with. Also, it needs to be reset often. I've tried updating the firmware, fooling with the settings that the network-geeks told me to do on various forums, all with little or no improvement. I recently bought a standalone WiFi router and that works all the time throughout the house. tl;dr - good internet connectivity, saves you the monthly rental fee, TERRIBLE wifi (save your frustration and buy the modem without the wifi)
customer_reviews.author: Michael Donlin

customer_reviews.title: ALL IN ONE, SECOND TO NONE!
customer_reviews.text: Damn near plug and play. Plugged everything in, loaded the CD ROM Software, rebooted my computer, attempted to log into my email account and BAM! Nothing. Well, no one ever mentioned, or I did not see or remember it, that you have to call your Cable Internet Service Provider so that they can activate your hardware by identifying, cataloging it and configuring a signal to send out to your unit. Once this is complete, this baby was ready to go and works wonderfully. All passcodes, keys and ID numbers are located either on the bottom or the side of the unit so its all there to present and provide to other WIFI members in your household or network.
customer_reviews.author: BIG SAM

customer_reviews.title: Great Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: I received the Motorola cable modem fast thanks to Amazon Prime. I bought this for my wife's mother and the installation was very easy and straight forward. You have to call the cable company and give them the mac address which was listed on a sticker on the bottom. This will save you from having to pay rent to your cable company each month for one provided by them. The web interface was easy to use and the only thing I found wrong was the admin password was incorrect in the paperwork. The password was "motorola" not password as it said in the instructions. I would recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: klm

customer_reviews.title: Wireless is Junk!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk. I bought this device on a friends recommendation without doing my own research, that's the last time I will do that. The modem portion works great but the wireless drops constantly and I mean many, many times a day. Adjustments to the device don't help. Called the support number for this device, that didn't help. If you are thinking of buying this product simply Google the model, it has been an issue for years and there are hundreds if not thousands of posts on this particular product, some claim that they were able to fix the issues, but save yourself the headache and buy a different brand. For a sample of complaints, you can check out this link.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Work Around Provided For Time Warner Customers
customer_reviews.text: Great unit! A modem and router in one, and it comes with a work around for Time Warner customers that addresses issues with the TW system when connecting customer owned equipment. Have not had any issues once getting it set up...if you have issues with the wireless working on Time Warner don't let the "Tech" fool you. Following the directions provided will get the thing connected and working, however, if the power goes out you have to redo the setup so don't toss the directions.
customer_reviews.author: Revcogg

customer_reviews.title: Cannot update firmware without paying for service provider's assistance
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this modem after checking Time Warner's website for acceptable devices. I wanted to be able to update/change settings on my own modem, and I liked that the Wi-Fi was integrated. Been using it for almost two months, and now I can't get a Wi-Fi signal down the hall. Went to go update the firmware, and found out I CANNOT update the firmware!!!!!! I have to call Time Warner for this delightful service, which puts me back in the same shark-infested waters I was trying to avoid. Disappointed, upset and frustrated. I thought Motorola had more integrity than this.
customer_reviews.author: Little Bit

customer_reviews.title: NO Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected...then died 7 months later... would NOT recommend this piece of junk!!!! This is a light weight, flimsy piece of plastic. When I looked to return it, I found that it was only a 3 month warranty. NEVER AGAIN WILL I EVER ORDER ANYTHING FROM OR THROUGH AMAZON EVEN AT BARGAIN PRICES!!! $116 Down the drain. I thought I could save money by not having to rent a router from the cable company. I will order a better one, but from Tiger direct, or B&H, or from walmart (who has an excellent return policy! A 3 MONTH WARRANTY ON SOMETHING THAT SHOULD LAST YEARS? I know you don't care, but good bye forever Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: dremoski

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished problem
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the "used" from Amazon. Gave it 2 stars, because set up seems easy and it may be ok if new. Was able to set up Ethernet with Time Warner Cable, but unable to get the WiFi to work at all. TWC installer tried and failed; as did TWC tech support. Spoke with ARRIS technical support and suggested returning the box. Went through complete default reinstall without success. Apparently some cable companies permanently disable the wireless features of customers that do not subscribe to wireless service. I ordered a new netgear router and returned this box.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine when it worked
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to use with Comcast (in Houston). Worked fine when it worked, but it would drop the signal intermittently so that I'd have to wait for service (web page loading) for 1 to 4 minutes. Perhaps the problem was due to idiosyncratic aspect of my setup, but whatever, it wasn't tolerable so I returned both of them. Kudos to Amazon for their outstanding service on both.
customer_reviews.author: JKJ

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your internet provider
customer_reviews.text: Not too easy to get settings right with my internet company. This may be the twc tech support who can't seem to get it right in our area. (twc only option in our area ) I tried to change password but was unsuccessful so we have to use the ridiculously long preset one. I had no problem with my old router modem also SB so don't know what problem is. I gave up.. It does improve my speed which is why I upgraded but getting the settings to stick took several weeks of tech support every three to for days. Works great now.
customer_reviews.author: Katie g

customer_reviews.title: The advertising is bad. The dualband router is a SBG6590-2
customer_reviews.text: Problem 1. This is NOT a dualband router. It is a singleband router. So I spent $30 on something I have to return, after the ISP tech set it up. The advertising is bad. The dualband router is a SBG6590-2. This is a SBG6580 Bad advertising. Bad bad bad. Problem 2: It constantly drops my connection .. like every 15 minutes. I hate this thing. Hate hate hate.
customer_reviews.author: Thug's Ma

customer_reviews.title: Great all-in-one product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great all-in-one unit we purchased for my mother-in-law. It does everything it is supposed to do, and doesn't need to be reset all of the time like her last setup, which was a SURFboard modem with a separate router. We had to relocate the unit to the second floor in order to get the best possible coverage (such as backyard deck), which was not a problem because there are cable outlets everywhere. Setup was easy. Mother-in-law has had this product for 6 months now and I have had zero calls from her for help with it! Woohoo!
customer_reviews.author: JMB1101

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed. Wireless connection drops frequently. Wireless speed is over 4 times slower than the cable connection. I purchased this product in May 2015. Started facing the signal drop issue since then. Unfortunately forgot to return within 30 days and for that mistake of mine, I am still suffering. I contacted Arris customer care, assuming since I bought it in May 2015, it would still be covered under Arris 2 years warranty. But to my shock, based on product serial number Arris said the warranty had expired in July 2014 itself!!! Meaning this product when it was being sold on Amazon was already almost 3 years old. Now I understand what Retail Packaging means....Wasted $127.40
customer_reviews.author: SHANT

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item when my cable company sent me a notice that they were going to start charging me a monthly fee to rent their modem. I searched around for a good deal on a good modem and found this one. This also enabled me to get rid of my wireless router since the modem has that build in as well. I am very happy with this purchase decision. The modem was easy to set up and works great. This modem is good for larger bandwidths and internet speeds. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a top of the line modem/wireless router.
customer_reviews.author: habsfan23

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I have Time Warner Cable Phone & Internet and by purchasing this combo router and modem, I am not only saving the ongoing TWC monthly fee to use their modem for internet, but I also have WiFi throughout my apartment. This unit was at a lower price ($49) because it was used, but in like new condition, at less than half the price if I had purchased new. It is working wonderfully daily, and I am very glad I made this purchase. So far, so good, no issues at all. I highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jane's Naturals

customer_reviews.title: "Refurbished"
customer_reviews.text: My unit had an issue where it would get hot and lose connection. I opened it up to see what might be causing this to find it FILLED with dead spiders. I'm going to only buy new from now on. The modem itself is lacking most features. Wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.author: Tj

customer_reviews.title: much better internet.
customer_reviews.text: worked great for a week, after reading other reviews, it happened to me. the connection cannot handle three computers and three iPhones, Atnt modem did better. the wireless part is Very weak. I wish I didn't throw out the box so I can return for an upgrade. I hard wire connection to speed test and received about 48mps. wireless barley pushes 22 and is very spotty. I have to keep restarting the wireless adapter, and modem. If Arris will take this unit back with no box and charge me the difference for the higher quality, I will do it.
customer_reviews.author: paul valles

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but there was a crucial documentation error.
customer_reviews.text: Just got the 6580 configured and connecting through it now. Lots of capability and highly configurable. The set up sheet included in the packaging gave an incorrect default password. Fortunately, I downloaded the User Manual before I returned the old modem, which did have the correct password or I would have been up the creek. Be advised to download the User Manual before you do this. Additionally, the user manual does not go into depth on several advanced settings that I want to configure. In summary: Good product, but there was a crucial documentation error. Otherwise this would be a 5 Star.
customer_reviews.author: MBuckner

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Comcast Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: I've had this hooked up for about 3 weeks now and have not had any problems. I have not had any disconnect issues and I get a strong signal to all my wifi devices (currently a count of 10). My download speed are at around 92 mps and up load is at 52. This is with the Xfinity Extreme 105 internet package. This will save me money over the course of my contract which is what I was wanting to accomplish. Overall very satisfied with this.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I found out that my local cable company has started to charge for "rental" of truly cruddy modems. But by having my own I will achieve payback in a year, which is better than a stock that doubles in a year because there are no taxes on the savings. It also produces a strong wireless signal, and has four wired RJ-45 connections. The only downside is that if it stops working, is that you will have to buy a new one. But the only modems that I have ever had (many since 1980) that stopped working, were the ones from the cable company.
customer_reviews.author: Groaker

customer_reviews.title: SURFboard Wireless
customer_reviews.text: The setup was simple but it was a hassle getting Comcast to activate it. I spent 3 hours on the phone waiting (had 4 hang-ups during that time and was switched to someone else twice between hang-ups) but the actual activation time was less than 10 minutes. The WPS button is great if you have a WPS activated device - makes the set-up easy on these devices. The signal could be a little stronger but overall I'm satisfied. I have 10 different devices hooked up to the router and haven't had any problems getting on-line. The wireless streaming has been great and I haven't had any problem with the video pausing while streaming movies and shows.
customer_reviews.author: ntim

customer_reviews.title: Great modem, mediocre WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Since I got this and installed it, I have had a much stronger and more reliable connection on my wired computer. The downfall of this modem though is it's lackluster Wi-Fi and its administrative web page. I have a separate Asus router that not only allows for a faster connection over Wi-Fi and greater signal distance, but has much better tools for monitoring and administrating the connections of other users on your network. If you're not as worried about controlling your network and or have a smaller area to cover, then this component will work fine for you. As it is, I'm using the modem, but have disabled the Wi-Fi and am using my Asus router instead.
customer_reviews.author: Rio Grande Valley Shopper

customer_reviews.title: WORST PRODUCT EVER. THIS THING CAME WITH A HOLE IN THE FRONT AND A BIG BLACK X ON THE BACK. WONDER WHAT THAT BLACK X MEANS.
customer_reviews.text: WORST PRODUCT EVER. THIS THING CAME WITH A HOLE IN THE FRONT AND A BIG BLACK X ON THE BACK. WONDER WHAT THAT BLACK X MEANS. IT DOESN'T WORK IT'S A RETURN, AND STILL YOU GUYS SENT IT TO ME. UNLESS IT WAS A BLIND MAN PULLING THIS ORDER HE SHOULD BE FIRE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JAN CHIN

customer_reviews.title: Wrong password, dropped internet.
customer_reviews.text: 1. Wrong password in setup instructions. Actual password is motorola NOT password... 2. States that the SBG6580 is backwards compatible with wireless G devices but my older laptop cannot access the internet. Local only... Once I was able to log in the software isn't very user friendly. Should be more in layman terms. So I'm not sure if I'm doing something wrong. 3. A few days installed and I'm experiencing dropped internet. Seems like the wireless router is crashing because I still have my old G router hooked up and my older devices are operating fine.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Good product, helpful support!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in good time and shape, and was super easy to install. I complicated things by calling my ISP (Comcast) and getting them involved. I should have just followed the directions - there were a lot of steps, but now that I've done it they all make sense. I like it that it's the modem and router in one small, compact unit. When I had a bit of connection trouble, I called Motorola and they were SUPER helpful - the issue was quickly resolved by changing the WiFi channel to a less-used one, so I have less competition for the bandwidth.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Motorola customer service is the worst
customer_reviews.text: Been having problems with the wireless dropping out since I purchased the modem 6 months ago. I have contacted customer service a half dozen times and all they want to do is change the channel and say its fixed. After resetting the modem the wireless starts dropping connections after about a week. My laptop, tablet, and phone all lose connection while everything plugged into the ethernet ports works fine. Customer service blames wireless congestion as the problem but all my other wireless work fine. currently I have a the wireless turned off and a Linksys router plugged into SBG6580.
customer_reviews.author: John McConn

customer_reviews.title: Bought the ARRIS SURFboard SBR-AC1750, at the same time ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the ARRIS SURFboard SBR-AC1750, at the same time, both for $75. This seems to get hot, but so far works okay. I have to unplug (reset) both about once a week for all websites to work properly. For instance, Craigslist, and the Kroger website won't load. Reset both, and they load properly. All previous routers and modems had the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: fixitpro

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Dropping WiFi Signal!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT buy this unit. This unit continuously drops the WiFi connection on my all my Apple devices - MacBook (1), iPhone's (4) , and iPads (2). I couldn't figure out why my data usage was high - it's because the iPhones kept dropping WiFi and switching to cellular data. What's strange? My Windows tablets and PC's seem to work more consistently.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kimura

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy - reliability and longevity are questionable
customer_reviews.text: Modem bricked and failed entirely not even after a year. Had multiple issues where modem would just hang and not send or receive data even though devices are connected to it (required a hard restart). Threw it away immediately after no amount of restarting or connecting via wired connection could bring it back to normal operation. There are better modems out there. Avoid this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive solution to access your ISP without rental payment.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, proven technology although long in tooth. Make sure your provider will provision it so it can be used and change credentials on router for security. There are better out there but not sub-$50.00 (reconditioned).
customer_reviews.author: @Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1 for 2
customer_reviews.text: 1st arrived DOA and Motorola support was not good but eventually suggested I return to Amazon. Amazon replaced within 12 hours and new unit installed easily and appears to be working well on Comcast. I setup WiFi and Guest network no problem, and so far no issues have been noted. When provisioning, the tech support person told me he thinks this is the best of the combined router-WiFi units, for what that is worth. He said some manufacturers products were trouble, but did not say whose. I have several other properties with Comcast and anticipate replacing all of them with this unit if no problems are discovered in a month.
customer_reviews.author: Cicero

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to call Time Warner and have it added to my account, I was operational immediately. I checked and IP-Flood was NOT enabled, I think this may be enabled with auto configuration, but as others have stated it shouldn't be enabled. I neglected to run the disc, I opted to configure on my own. I had no issues at all, I found the settings and GUI to be intuitive enough and was able to breeze through it all in just a few minutes. I'd buy this again and again. Motorola comes through with a 5/5 product, again. One note, default username: admin password: motorola This is to access the gateway @ 192.168.100.1
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The kids quit complaining they couldn't get a signal in other parts of the house, and we quit renting a box from the cable compa
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you check the reviews and get your upstream/downstream power adjustments done by your cable provider. After we got the upstream (transmission) power level brought down into the ideal range (per Motorola support line) of 36-46, everything is fine. Our upstream was running 48.9-49.9, which we were told can cause connectivity issues. The kids quit complaining they couldn't get a signal in other parts of the house, and we quit renting a box from the cable company. Win/win.
customer_reviews.author: Crockett

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable Compromise for modem and wireless router
customer_reviews.text: The modem works well, the router does not have the range a dedicated wireeless router is capable of. Recently Arris updated the software for this model. It appears to have solved a problem I have been having with the wifi signal dropping every few minutes for about 20 seconds. The combined modem wireless router is much cheaper and more compact than having a dedicated modem and wireless router. The router has both 2.4g and 5g transmission but it does not transmit both bands at the same time. You can only transmit one band or the other by checking a box in the software set up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Wifi capabilities
customer_reviews.text: Works great if using the WiFi within 20 foot or so. Had a Motorola DOCSIS 2.0 before this that would send a WiFi signal across the entire house and out into the back yard which was great for the patio smart TV and streaming music around the fire pit. This thing is lame. Shopping for a different one now
customer_reviews.author: flyemlow

customer_reviews.title: Terrible..
customer_reviews.text: purchased this as an acceptable router/modem unit as advised by Comcast. this is already the 2nd unit we have..and it still doesn't work the way it should. says we have no internet access....and we need to unplug and restart it for the wifi to pick up. Ive had Comcast here twice who shared with me the diagnostic report that the signal I'm paying for is very strong and being sent to our home. Yet this device is not projecting the service throughout my home for us to link on. Terrible....
customer_reviews.author: LLA

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied...Wireless Router will NOT impress you.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this SURFboard. DOCSIS 3.0 is MUCH faster, right? I had to contact my cable provider (Comcast) and increase my service from 12Mbps to 16. I have noticed the increase. However, the wireless router on this modem is horrible. The documentation lacks any directions to optimize the settings. I searched and found similar reviews. The wireless drops me constantly. I have tried several devices in my house. I finally disabled the wireless router and went back to my old router. Linksys WRT160Nv2. I am somewhat satisfied with this combo, just very disappointed in the wireless function of the Motorola which was a lot of the motivation for buying it originally.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing service life
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for 2 1/2 years, then the router went crazy. It needs a reset every few hours to every few minutes for devices to successfully connect to the internet. Under it's settings, it behaves very strangely (e.g., showing known devices as connected, but without an IP address or device name - I can only identify them by MAC address). It's effectively no longer usable. After 2.5 years, I should not have to be on the market for a new router already.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: works great on comcast
customer_reviews.text: works great on comcast i did a swap to save the $8 month fee so in a sense 18 months from now it is free and then i profit the $8 a month savings hook up was easy cable and my 2 network cables (pc and xbox) then called comcast they conected in about 10 min on phone. all done wirless works great with family phones have not tried anything els yet. its a little smaller then the one i had rented from comcast wich is nice im sure it because this one does not have phone lines . we use cell so that didnt matter to me.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: 4 GHz and also some new like Amazon Fire tab which only takes 2
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Cheap. Works ok. Cons: Small Range, Dual band they say but you cannot have dual band simultaneously. Either 2.4 Ghz or 5 Ghz at any given time. So right now I have some old things which need 2.4 GHz and also some new like Amazon Fire tab which only takes 2.4 GHz but if I lower the frequency to 2.4 GHz then internet will be slow. So if you are looking to connect dual band electronics at the same time then you have a problem and this is not the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Shishir

customer_reviews.title: good modem/router solution
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Modem by my internet provider recommendation, although the very sophisticate reviews, I decided to buy it in order to have really fast internet. Technical: when using the network cable connection it is very fast and doing exactly as stated. however, the wireless support is less than stated or less cover / speed than the linksys N620 - non-comparable. the wireless distance does not cover full house distance/space and sometimes need to change the location (in-house) to be closer to the modem. in general: good product however if the Wi-fi distance and speed important to you buy separate modem and separate good wireless routing solution.
customer_reviews.author: Ben G.

customer_reviews.title: Worst Amazon purchase Ever!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this modem in August it worked great until 4 months later and started rebutting itself constantly and kicking us of are internet connection. Comcast came out and told us that are modem had a major glitch. We paid a good chunk of change for it to fail on us in 4 months but the best part is that the seller said it's past the 90 day return and there was nothing they could do. I just think that's weird that it last only just long enough for the policy to be void! Well we but the bullet and paid for a router from Comcast that is twice is much but works great. Thanks Motorola!! :((((((
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Davis

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Darn it! It's not dual band. I mean it has both bands...but you got to pick 1 or the other. (2.4 or 5 GHZ)
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrie7

customer_reviews.title: I LOVED this!
customer_reviews.text: It connected with my Comcast/Xfinity just perfectly. I didn't have any major issues with it. In the year or so that I've used it consistently, I've had only minor issues & that was maybe 2 - 3x's. Nothing unplugging & plugging didn't fix, though. For what I saved on the month - to - month rental fees with Comcast/Xfinity, I LOVED this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SBG6580 had problems long ago... now completely good to go
customer_reviews.text: I am a IT guy and we frequently provision comcast... I just provisioned a SBG6580 for a comcast customer on the 105Mb tier .... I called them up, selected the service tier, read them the mac address, it restarted.... they auto pushed 3.3.1 then restarted again... and it pulled down 100+ Mb first try over the 5ghz band no problem.... I didn't have to make any setup changes whatsoever... I would add that the modem was brand new, on 3.1.0, but had firewall enabled with all firewall options including ip flood protect disabled... so it looks like finally all systems go (even for people who only know how to plug it in) on the SBG6580 with Comcast.... enjoy...
customer_reviews.author: primeguy
